question: This 15th-century tempera on panel <image 1> is housed in Museums Sheffield and depicts which female saint?
description: The image is a 15th-century tempera on panel painting housed in Museums Sheffield. It depicts a female saint who is holding a tower-like structure with three tiers. The saint has long, curly hair and is wearing a green garment with a red cloak. She also wears a crown adorned with leaves and flowers. The background features a landscape with hills and a cloudy sky.
